org.tantalum

Class UITask

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.tantalum.Task
      • org.tantalum.UITask
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable, Workable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AsyncTask

    public abstract class UITask
extends Task
implements java.lang.Runnable
    A unit of work which, once the Task.doInBackground() is completed on a background Worker thread, should update the user interface from the UI Thread in onPostExecute(). This is the save behavior as an AsyncTask, but is suitable for short background tasks since it does not include the hook for periodically updating the user interface with ongoing progress.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class org.tantalum.Task

        CANCELED, chainedTask, EXCEPTION, EXEC_FINISHED, EXEC_PENDING, EXEC_STARTED, MAX_TIMEOUT, READY, status, UI_RUN_FINISHED

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      UITask()
      Create a Task which will also run onPostExecute() on the user interface (UI) thread after doInBackground() completes on a Worker thread The initial input value of the Task is null and may be set by a previous Task if this is chain()ed to another Task.
      UITask(java.lang.Object in)
      Create a UITask and specify the initial input value.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected java.lang.Object doInBackground(java.lang.Object in)
      You may optionally override this method if you wish to perform work on a Worker thread before proceeding to the UI thread.
      protected abstract void onPostExecute(java.lang.Object result)
      Override this method with the work you want to complete on the UI thread after the Task is complete on the Worker thread.
      void run()
      Execute onPostExecute() in the background with status transitions to the Task state.

        cancel, chain, exec, fork, fork, get, getStatus, getStatusString, getValue, isCanceled, join, join, joinAll, joinAllUI, joinUI, joinUI, notifyTaskForked, onCanceled, set, setStatus, setValue, toString

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • UITask

        public UITask()
        Create a Task which will also run onPostExecute() on the user interface (UI) thread after doInBackground() completes on a Worker thread The initial input value of the Task is null and may be set by a previous Task if this is chain()ed to another Task.

      • UITask

        public UITask(java.lang.Object in)
        Create a UITask and specify the initial input value. This type of UITask does not need to be chained to a previous task to receive input parameters so you can call fork() on it directly rather than chain()ing it to another Task.
        Parameters:
        in -

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public final void run()
        Execute onPostExecute() in the background with status transitions to the Task state. Do not call this directly. It will be called automatically on the UI thread after doInBackground() completes successfully on a background Worker thread.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • doInBackground

        protected java.lang.Object doInBackground(java.lang.Object in)
